sect1.title: lm_sensors-&lm_sensors-version;

sect2.title: Kernel Configuration
sect2.para: Getting your kernel config right is an iterative process that may require that you recompile your kernel a couple of times. The simplest way to go about it is to start by enabling modules and then compile everything that may be needed by Lm Sensors as a module:

screen.literal:
General setup ---> [*] Prompt for development and/or incomplete code/drivers
[*] Enable loadable module support --->
Bus options (PCI etc.) ---> [*] PCI support
Device Drivers ---> [*] I2C support [*] I2C device interface I2C Algorithms ---> <M> (configure all of them as modules) I2C Hardware Bus support ---> <M> (configure all of them as modules) I2C Hardware Bus support ---> <M> (configure all of them as modules) [*] Hardware Monitoring support ---> <M> (configure all of them as modules)

sect2.para: Recompile your kernel and reboot into the new kernel. Don't forget to make modules_install We will come back to the kernel in the Configuring section below.

sect2.title: Installation of Lm Sensors
sect2.para: Install Lm Sensors by running the following commands:
This package does not come with a test suite.

screen.userinput: make PREFIX=/usr BUILD_STATIC_LIB=0 \ MANDIR=/usr/share/man install && mkdir -p /usr/share/doc/lm_sensors-&lm_sensors-version; && cp -rf doc/* /usr/share/doc/lm_sensors-&lm_sensors-version;

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: BUILD_STATIC_LIB=0: This parameter disables compiling and installing the static version of libsensors.

PROG_EXTRA=sensord: This parameter enables compiling sensord, a daemon that can monitor your system at regular intervals. Compiling sensord requires RRDtool. Compiling RRDtool 1.4.6 requires a sed: sed -i '/ sv_undef/d' bindings/perl-shared/RRDs.xs.
